result.execSummary:
All charges against Otis B O'Claire in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Otis B O'Claire is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Otis B O'Claire

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Otis B O'Claire.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Otis B O'Claire.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for SPEEDY Jury Trial on 10/24/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case rescheduled off the record.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Otis B O'Claire.  Attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant previously entered a speedy trial demand that expires on 12-13-2022.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 41. The final pretrial will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court is down and is unable to hear this case.  Court will reschedule bail review hearing.  Parties emailed new court date. Case scheduled for Bail Review Hearing on 9/22/2022 at 1:30 pm by zoom.
Defense Counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires December 13, 2022

Defendant Otis B O'Claire appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Otis B O'Claire.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #21CF4650. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Conner. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense requests a bail review date and a Speedy Trial Demand. Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court by video, defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with J.L.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES:
Defendant Otis B O'Claire in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Otis B O'Claire in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
